title: Implement cleanup strategy display with color coding
description:
Add visual phase between discovery and confirmation:

**Phase: Strategy Preview** - Show cleanup plan for each project with color coding.

**Colors:**
- GREEN: Safe commands (cargo clean, npm ci, gradle clean) - will be executed
- YELLOW: Tentative commands (make clean) - exists in Makefile but uncertain
- RED: Paths/globs to be deleted (target/, node_modules/, *.o) - destructive

**Format:**


**Implementation:**
1. Create CleanupStrategy struct with:
   - safeCommands: [(command: String, color: .green)]
   - tentativeCommands: [(command: String, color: .yellow)]
   - pathsToDelete: [(path: String, glob: String?, size: UInt64)]
2. For each project type in CLEANUP_RECIPES.md, populate strategy
3. Display in preview phase with colors
4. Calculate total space freed across all projects
5. User sees exact plan before confirmation

Depends on: devdug-2fu (cleanup strategy definitions) ✓ complete
Blocked by: None

title: Post-mortem: Lost Android Studio projects to careless cleanup
description:
Lesson learned: User accidentally deleted all Android Studio projects yesterday while trying to free disk space using ad-hoc rm commands.

**Why this can't happen with devdug:**

1. **Strategy Preview mandatory** - Must see exactly what will be deleted before confirmation
2. **Multiple confirmations** - Can't proceed without explicit double confirmation
3. **Color-coded warnings** - RED paths stand out as destructive actions
4. **Cleanup status bar** - User always knows what phase they're in (Discovery → Display → Strategy → Confirm → Execute)
5. **Logging** - Future: log all deletions to ~/devdug-cleanup.log
6. **Non-interactive safety** - Can't accidentally run with wrong flags

**Design implications:**
- Strategy Preview is NOT optional - it's the safety valve
- Top status bar prevents confusion about what's happening
- Execution phase stays blocked until preview+confirmation working perfectly

This project exists to solve this exact problem.

title: Add unit tests for cleanup logic
description: Write comprehensive unit tests for the file cleanup and deletion logic in the core module

title: Define cleanup strategies for each project type
description:
Map project types to cleanup strategies (both approaches):

**Approach 1: Safe command execution** (when available)
- cargo → cargo clean
- npm → npm ci --prefer-offline (reinstall from lock)
- gradle → ./gradlew clean
- maven → mvn clean

**Approach 2: Direct deletion of artifacts** (always works, calculates space)
- cargo → rm -rf target/
- npm → rm -rf node_modules/ (recalculate: npm install from lock)
- python-pip → rm -rf __pycache__/ dist/ build/ *.egg-info/
- gradle → rm -rf build/
- maven → rm -rf target/
- xcode → rm -rf ~/Library/Developer/Xcode/DerivedData/ProjectName-*
- intellij-idea → rm -rf .idea/cache/ .idea/caches/ .idea/shelf/
- eclipse → rm -rf .metadata/ .recommenders/ .settings/ bin/
- cmake → rm -rf cmake-build-*/
- go → rm -rf vendor/ (if vendor dir)

Benefit of paths: pre-calculate total disk space that will be freed and show in --clean mode before user confirms.

Create CleanupStrategy struct with both fields, use command when safe else fall back to paths.

title: Add intellij-platform aggregation in status summary
description: Group intellij-idea, android-studio, rustrover, clion, etc. under 'intellij-platform' in final status report to show total JetBrains IDE projects

title: Build macOS GUI project browser - Finder-style folder navigator
description: Create a minimalist macOS GUI that displays projects as folder icons in a Finder/Explorer-style window. Programmatic only, no bundles or UI designers. Uses vanilla macOS defaults for styling.

title: Implement draggable sidebar divider
description: Make the divider between sidebar and content resizable by dragging horizontally. Keep sidebar width between 100-400px. Smooth dragging with live preview.

title: Review project type detection - original finds 129 vs refactored finds 100
description: Original devdug.swift detects 129 projects while refactored DevdugCore detects 100. The original may be over-detecting (e.g., including build scripts, Eclipse workspaces, Android studio). Refactored is more conservative but may miss some legitimate project types. Need to audit which projects are being missed and determine if they're real projects or false positives.

title: Support dark mode in GUI
description: Add proper dark mode support to the macOS GUI with system theme detection

title: Task 2: Project discovery and listing
description: - Scan home directory for project directories

title: Task 4: Folder icon generation
description: - Use NSImage to create folder icons

title: Add SwiftUI performance profiling
description: Profile SwiftUI view rendering and identify bottlenecks in the GUI project browser

title: Refactor Types.swift for better type safety
description: Review and improve type definitions in DevdugCore/Types.swift for better compile-time safety

title: Explore alternative GUI frameworks
description: Evaluate Odin or other frameworks for faster/lighter GUI implementation

title: Task 1: Set up minimal Swift project structure
description: - Create Package.swift with AppKit dependency

title: Add top status bar with phase navigation
description:
Add top line status bar showing current phase with context:

**Phase definitions:**
1. Detection (scanning IDEs + home dir)
2. Display (showing discovered projects)
3. Strategy (cleanup plan preview)
4. Confirmation (user approval)
5. Execution (actually cleaning)

**Top bar format** (adapts to terminal width):

Wide (120+ cols): Phase 3/5: Display ... Strategy Preview ... Confirmation
Medium (80 cols): Phase 3/5: Display ... Strategy ... Confirm
Narrow (40 cols): 3/5: Display|Strategy|Confirm

**Implementation:**
- Use full names when width permits
- Fall back to abbreviated: Display→Disp, Strategy→Strat, Confirmation→Confirm, Execution→Exec
- Show prev ... current ... next phase names
- Use '...' or '…' separator
- Stick to top line (save/restore cursor like bottom bar)
- Bold or inverse current phase name

Pairs well with bottom status bar (project counts) for complete UX.

title: CLI segfaults during home directory scanning
description: After refactoring to library, the CLI crashes with segmentation fault during scanHomeDirectory phase. The original devdug.swift script works fine. Likely issue in Discovery.scanHomeDirectory() or recursive directory traversal hitting problematic paths or symlink loops.

title: Add cleanup strategy preview phase
description:
Insert preview phase between discovery and confirmation:

Current flow: Discovery → Display → Confirm → Execute

New flow: Discovery → Display → [PAUSE: press key] → Strategy Preview → Confirm → Execute

In Strategy Preview phase:
- For each discovered project, show cleanup plan
- Format: 'ProjectName (type): Will run cargo clean / Will delete target/ (245MB)'
- Let user see exactly what will happen before confirmation
- Calculate total space to be freed across all projects
- Show both safe command (if available) and fallback paths

Blocked by: devdug-2fu (cleanup strategy definitions)

title: Integrate Nerd Fonts for project type icons
description: Evaluate and integrate Nerd Fonts (https://www.nerdfonts.com) for rich icon support in the macOS GUI project browser. Use appropriate icons for different project types (Swift, Rust, Go, Node, etc.) and file system locations.

title: Implement system Nerd Font detection
description: Implement font detection logic in Swift to query available system fonts and identify installed Nerd Fonts. Output detected font info to stderr for debugging/verification. Use NSFontManager or NSFont.familyNames to scan system fonts and filter for 'Nerd Font' in the name. This is a foundational task - actual font UI implementation and glyph selection will be separate follow-up issues.

title: Dry-run mode by default with confirmation gates
description: Implement default dry-run behavior. Require: 1) command-line flag to disable dry-run, 2) display what will be cleaned, 3) two confirmation prompts before actual deletion

title: Implement actual deletion/cleanup
description:
Implement actual deletion/cleanup of artifacts

**BLOCKED intentionally:** This is dangerous. Only implement after:
- devdug-ty0: Strategy Preview phase (show exactly what will be deleted)
- devdug-pfb: Top status bar with phase navigation (user knows where they are)

**Only proceed when:**
1. User has seen full cleanup plan in Strategy Preview
2. User has confirmed twice (current flow)
3. Both status bars working (top: phase nav, bottom: project counts)

**Implementation details (when unblocked):**
- Execute cleanup actions in order: safe commands first, then paths
- Use FileManager for deletions (handle permissions gracefully)
- Log what was deleted
- Show completion summary: 'Freed X.XGB across Y projects'

**Safety:**
- Never delete without explicit user confirmation
- Log all deletions (consider ~/devdug-cleanup.log)
- Handle permission errors gracefully (skip, don't crash)
- Test thoroughly on smaller projects before release

title: Explore & integrate TUI libraries for progress/status display
description:
Research lightweight TUI options for Swift or alternative approaches:
- Ratatui (Rust): mature, full-featured TUI framework
- Clime (Go): minimal progress bars and spinners
- Other Swift terminal libraries
- Consider: compile to binary vs shell script mode limitations
- Goal: scrollable messages + progress bar + status line during scanning

title: Dynamically detect terminal height for responsive scroll regions
description: Get actual terminal rows (via LINES env var, tput, or stty). Use that to size scroll region intelligently. Allow status bar to grow to 2-3 lines when needed. Test with various terminal sizes.

title: Auto-wrap status bar when project type counts exceed line width
description: Currently hard-coded to 80-char width. Make dynamic based on terminal width. Wrap to next line(s) if needed. Consider grouping by category (jvm, rust, zig, web, etc)

title: Detect and map IDE project locations
description: Identify standard locations for: XCode projects, IntelliJ IDEA, RustRover, Android Studio, Eclipse. Check installed IDEs on system. Build location mapping.

title: Parse IDE workspace/project files
description: Parse .xcworkspace, .idea files, Eclipse .project files, RustRover configs to extract project information

title: Directory structure detection and sniffing
description: Scan directories for IDE/language/company-specific dotfiles, dotdirs, config files, XML/plist files. Implement heuristic detection for project types.

title: List mode implementation
description: Create 'list' command to enumerate all discovered projects: started, forgotten, downloaded, cloned. Show details.

title: macOS firmlink handling
description: Properly walk macOS firmlinks without duplicate counting. Use Swift to leverage native APIs if needed.

title: Language choice: Swift vs Odin
description: Decide implementation language. Swift script mode vs compiled Odin. Consider: macOS firmlinks, distribution, maintainability.

title: Parse IntelliJ project files for metadata
description: Read .idea config files (modules.xml, misc.xml, vcs.xml) to extract: project type (Kotlin vs Java), multiplatform vs single-platform, dependencies, JVM version, VCS info

title: Detect and parse Eclipse workspace structure
description: Find Eclipse projects scattered in workspace or elsewhere. Parse .project and .classpath files. Handle Ghidra projects specifically.

title: Memory leak in Finder navigator
description: High memory usage when navigating large directory trees - investigate retain cycles in SwiftUI

title: Investigate and fix memory leak
description: Debug and fix the high memory usage issue in the Finder navigator
